Reviews.Title: Extremely simple, effective, and VERY loud alarm system
Reviews.Author: E. Kim
Reviews.Content: I live in an apartment and wanted to add an inexpensive alarm system that could serve as a deterrent to intruders.  I know that this GE system cannot substitute for a centralized alarm system in which authorities/police are immediately notified, but I felt that the activation of a loud alarm could scare off an unsuspecting burglar and was far better than not having any alarm system.  It could also serve to wake you up at night as soon as a window or door is opened, giving you precious seconds to call 911, freak out, pray, reach for your 9mm, etc.  (I mean this jokingly, but nevertheless, it is better than waking up to an intruder by your bedside.)The main door unit is extremely easy to set up.  You unscrew the back and install 3 AAA batteries and program a 4 digit code.  You can also set the device to serve as a simple door chime, instead of an alarm if you desire.  You mount the door device and its accompanying magnetic sensor to the door frame and to the door.  The kit includes double-sided tape and the sensors have openings for you to use a woodscrew.  I just chose to use some double-sided Velcro tape but obviously, it would be better to screw the sensors in directly.Once you activate the alarm, you have 45 seconds to leave your apt/home.  When you want to enter your armed home, you open your door, and then are given 30 seconds to punch in your alarm before it is triggered.  This alarm is very loud, and I believe will at least startle most unsuspecting burglars and also potentially wake up your neighbors.The kit also includes 3 very simple window alarm and sensor pairs.  These are very easy to set up as they only have an on/off switch (besides the battery test switch).  You simply attach the sensor pairs to the windows and flip the switch to on.  If you want to open your window, you have to flip the switch to off, then open.  These are really just deterrents, but I believe effective.  In theory, an extremely relaxed, prepared burglar could just open your windows, study the device, and realize that he had to just flip the switch off.  While the door alarm is very loud, the window alarms are not nearly that loud and perhaps just acceptable.Again, if you live in an apartment without any alarm system presently, this system is infinitely better than not having anything.  The alarm is so shockingly loud, that I sleep better at night knowing that I would be notified the very first moment an intruder enters (minus the 30 second "grace period" for the alarm to trigger).  This can be a part of a more comprehensive security plan, which could include stronger door/window locks, lighting, signs of alarm system, alarm, guard dogs, self-defense education, TASER, pepperspray, tactical flashlight, firearms, etc.  You must tailor a security system to your own specific needs, budget, practical concerns, etc.

Reviews.Title: Door and Window alarms are very audible and effective.
Reviews.Author: Marmalade
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews posted here, I was actually surprised at the loudness of the 3 window alarms.  Perhaps the batteries were fresh, because all of the window and the door alarms I received are piercingly loud at 120-decibels.  The kits I received did come with all the necessary screws and double-sided tape to install the door and window alarms.  But, I used double-sided Velcro tape (as recommended by a reviewer) and this has worked like a charm!  Using chime mode, the kits have been very effective alert systems for toddlers in the house.  Also, if strategically placed, a burglar won't be able to see the window alarm attached to the frame.  It would be nice if the chime made a double set of 'ding-dong' sounds instead of a single set, but this is the only mild complaint I have about chime mode.  Also, the door system is pretty effective in alarm mode.  The alarm will continue to pierce even if the door is closed after being opened, so the only way to turn off the sound is to enter your 4-digit code.All in all, more than I expected and I'm extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Needed
Reviews.Author: LitWit "Lacey"
Reviews.Content: As a college student living in a college town apartment complex with a fiance who is gone the majority of the week for work this alarm system allows me to sleep peacefully at night.  As a worrier who is 26 years old I have read one too many accounts of terrible incidents occurring at night.  I am attending a college in the heart of the Midwest and my apartment building is well lit and closer to cornfields than anything anyone would consider a threat.  However, with college gearing up, kids getting rowdy, and a sea of unidentifiable people; one never knows what might happen...better safe than sorry.  This system provided three alerts for windows (of which I have three) and while the alarm sounding is softer than the main sounding you will hear on the door it is more than sufficient for my space.  There is no possible way I would not hear any one of the three if they were triggered.  The alarm sounding on the door is just plain loud...I suspect it would wake the entire apartment complex were it triggered.  There are two setting on the door alarm one is HOME...it is what I set in the evenings before heading to bed.  In the HOME mode the alarm will sound if the door is opened 1/2 inch and it will continue to sound until the door is closed or the code is entered.  The other mode the door offers is the AWAY mode...this is what I set when leaving.  In AWAY mode once door is opened one has 30 seconds to disarm the system before the alarm sounds.  Alarm can only be turned off when code is entered.  The window alarms have a CHIME or ALARM setting on them.  When switched to ALARM the alarm will sound when the window is opened 1/2 inch and continue sounding until the window is closed.  This systems primary function is to act as a deterrent for an intruder.  I would say that 99 out of 100 times the system will do its job at deterring crime.  However, if an intruder is determined or has the knowledge of the system they will know that in HOME mode the alram will cease to sound once the door is closed again...just as the windows will cease when they are once again closed.  In such a case I would argue that the system still buys one precious seconds they need to telephone for help...nothing is perfect.  I would reccommend this system to any young girl living on their own or any parent looking to keep their children safe away from home.

Reviews.Title: OK, but not great
Reviews.Author: B. Gould
Reviews.Content: The door alarm is pretty loud, but the screws to mount the sensors, which are mentioned in the instructions, aren't included. (double-sided tape is included.)Also, it would have been nice if there was a way to set the chime/alarm mode from the keypad (with the code) instead of having to open it (with a screwdriver).A 10-second warning beep before the alarm goes off would be nice too.The window alarms aren't very loud, and also, they turn off as soon as the window is closed.I put one on a sliding-glass door, and then discovered that... so, a burglar could open the door, come inside, and close the door, and the (not very loud) alarm would only go off for a few seconds.They really aren't loud enough to be heard by a neighbor, even in attached condos.I haven't checked to see how loud the door alarm is with the doors closed yet, but it is louder than the window alarms.Can't really complain for the price, but still, I was hoping it would have been a little better.

Reviews.Title: Limited use.
Reviews.Author: Sandypylos
Reviews.Content: This product was useless for me as it can only be installed if door/window and jamb are flush. If there is any moulding around the door the alarm cannot be installed correctly.

Reviews.Title: Great for It's Value!
Reviews.Author: Fuzzball
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently building a house. One of our soon-to-be neighbors told us that they saw some random people snooping around the new house at 2:00 a.m. What are the odds that someone at a construction site at 2:00 a.m. has any good intentions? Enter: need for an immediate burglar alarm system. The house is wired for a professional home security system, but we can't activate it yet until more construction is complete. I looked up battery-operated alarm systems and decided to try the GE system kit because of the mostly positive reviews.Overall, I think the system kit will fit most our needs. It's not the fanciest, but it's loud enough to wake up next door neighbors during the night and call attention to our house. I set the door alarm off while testing it out, and my ears were ringing for almost 30 min. As discussed in other reviews, the alarms might not be enough to protect against the more determined burglars, but I think it will ward off most. Plus, when combined with motion-activated floodlights and other defense measures, it becomes just another way to make burglars reconsider their plan.Setting the door alarm code is simple, and installation is easy after reading the instructions. I like the door alarm, but I wish it was not so bulky. The window alarms are not as loud as the door alarm, but they are still pretty loud. After installing the window alarms, I realized that my positioning of them made the "alarm, chime, off" label visible to an outsider looking in. I am probably going to run a black sharpie across the label so it won't look as obvious that it's an alarm, and hopefully the burglar won't go right to it.I have not come across any problems with false alarms yet. Hopefully that won't happen because the alarms are not on a timer and will continue to blare unless deactivated. Also, I live 30 mins away and will not know about any alarms going off unless a neighbor or police call me since the alarms are not tied to a phone system. The alarms are not controlled by a central unit, which makes it a little incovenient since I have to turn off all door/window alarms individually before the construction crew arrives. A little inconvenience, however, is still way better than having stuff stolen or the house vandalized.If you go to Youtube and do a search for "GE Personal Security JascoProducts," there should be a professional video and you can see a demonstration of the window alarm. Also, buying this kit on Amazon is a good value. I decided to buy more of these kits, and I saw either the exact same or almost the same GE kit (it had a door alarm and three window alarms) at Lowe's going for $36/each!UPDATE, November 29, 2011: It's been a few months now, and I've since installed a professional home security system. Overall, I am really happy with the GE alarms. Nobody tried to break in (fortunately), so we didn't have any real tests (no false alarms either!). A few things I noticed: First, one of our door alarms would require a few trys before recognizing the disarm code. Second, as previously mentioned in other reviews, it might be hard to install the door alarm if you have non-flat decorative door trim. The only reason I was able to use the door alarms is because I used the blue painters tape to stick the little door alarm magnet at an angle on the door trim, which made the doors pretty unsightly. You should be ok if you can stick a popsicle stick flat against your door trim at the site of the door magnet; otherwise, you may have get creative or consider not getting this product. I removed all the GE alarms after installing the professional security system, but I plan on keeping some for future use and giving others to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: P. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: simple installation.  just make sure you play with the window pieces first before actually sticking them on.  the window units are actually simplistic - can be turned off or remove, crushed, or thrown away by the intruder.  alarm is very loud but can be suffocated with a piece of cloth.  so, it works as advertised but may not be effective against sophisticated intruder(s).

Reviews.Title: You will get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: Well, it's true you get what you pay for I guess.  I will say that I am impressed with how loud the door units are but thats about the only positive comment I can come up with, and thats being generous.The window units are cheesy.  It's disappointing there is no way of permanently mounting the window units. Comes with 2 sided tape (pretty lame).  Although, it's probably a good thing since the window units are more like toys than anything.  If a thief did manage to hear the window unit alarm going off he might laugh so hard that he falls back out the window. So you can always bank on that happening anyways.The door units do not fit securely into the mounting bracket when placed on the door.  There is a flaw in the bracket design that allows to much play where the alarm unit merges with the mounting bracket.  It rattles around like the cheap junk that it is.There should be an indicator LED letting you know if the alarm is actually armed or not for the door units.  The only way to tell if it is armed is by entering in your pass code and then seeing if it beeps once for (armed) or twice for (disarmed).  Otherwise there is no way to tell if it's actually armed.The keypad on the door units if very annoying.  When you press the buttons to arm or disarm the alarm they make an piercing loud beep.  So loud in fact that I have to cover the alarm speaker area with my left hand while I arm it with my right hand or it will wake my wife at the other end of the house.You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: If it only worked...
Reviews.Author: Silvio Cuevas
Reviews.Content: It arrived well packed, it was very easy to install, I try several times to arm and disarm it and it was great. Very (I mean very) loud when it goes off.The only problem is that after one week, one day in the morning, when i try to disarm it was dead. I try to replace the batteries but nothing. It never worked againThe windows alarms unit work fine so far. Not as loud as the key padded unit but they do what they suppose to do.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money if you are interested in the AWAY mode
Reviews.Author: Hakan Haberdar
Reviews.Content: Since you connect it using a sticker and the alarm goes off several seconds after the door is opened, when you are not home, which is the AWAY mode, the suspect can simply throw this device away or break it down. DO NOT buy if you need the away mode. Actually, I do not even think that when you are inside the home, this will help you for the same reasons. The window unit is funny. If you close the window, it stops beeping... In a nutshell, another way of wasting your money. You must buy an alarm that goes off immediately and it should have a remote controller.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Furse
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about two weeks now and they work great!!  The alarm is very loud and I feel much safer living by myself in my little apartment.  I actually put on of the window alarms on my bedroom door so that I could have extra protection while I sleep.  It's a great product and absolutely worth the small amount of cost.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great piece of mind
Reviews.Author: Krista S.
Reviews.Content: I live in a 700sq ft apartment and I've always been a scaredy cat when it comes to door locks (double and triple checking locks before I go to bed lol).  Even though I live in a neighborhood with a very low crime rate, I still like having these alarms.  This device is easy to use, easy to mount, and easy to set up.  It took me all of 10 minutes to have all 4 alarms up and running in my apartment.  I have one on the front door, one on my sliding glass door and the other two on windows.As far as the complaints of it not being loud enough: In my apartment it is plenty loud.  I have set it off on purpose to test it and it was ear shattering!  Now, if you have a 2000-3000sq ft house then maybe I could agree with it not being loud enough depending on where you have it.  In an average size house or apartment though I think it is perfect.I also like the fact that the front door alarm has a code you can enter in (that you choose) when you leave the house to arm/disarm.  I feel a lot better knowing that when I leave the house the alarm is set and hopefully will scare off any potential intruders.Overall I would highly recommend this product to anyone, but especially to apartment dwellers and homeowners with smaller homes.

Reviews.Title: Much quieter than advertised
Reviews.Author: Platypi
Reviews.Content: These alarms are advertised to be 120 dB, which is in the range of a jet engine.  However, it was difficult to hear the alarm from two rooms over, and it would definitely not wake me out of bed.  I noticed that there was some controversy over the loudness of the alarm in previous reviews.  So I measured the loudness objectively with a SPL meter.  Three feet directly in front of the alarm, the sound level was 92 dB.  Three feet off to the side of the alarm, the sound level was 86 dB.  So optimistically, the alarm is 28 dB lower than advertised.  10^2.8 = 631, so the alarm is 631 times less loud (in terms of energy) than advertised.  92 dB is about the sound of a truck from 10 meters away, as opposed to the sound of a jet engine.

Reviews.Title: Right for the price.
Reviews.Author: David Lundgren
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I had recently been robbed at night while I was at home sleeping and realized I needed something to alert me if someone were to open my door while I'm home.  This unit has both a "Home" and "Away" mode and I use both.  I even reccomended this item to my neighbor and he went out and purchased one as well.  It is loud enough to be heard from a long way away and the first time I tested it my ears rang for a good 5 minutes afterward!  For the price it really is an excellent product and it is easy to set up and program.  It's certainly no where near the top of the line when it comes to home security systems but for my apartment it is perfect.  I hope that anyone else who purchases this item gets the same peace of mind I got after installing it.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't fit on recessed doors!
Reviews.Author: Mary Agner
Reviews.Content: I had to open the package and look at the alarm to see that it will only work on doors and windows that are flush. It won't work on recessed doors or doors and windows with curved woodwork. They should give this information upfront.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Allen D. Vestal "Allen"
Reviews.Content: As others have stated door alarm is very loud window alarms not that loud. There is some misinformation in some of the comments. You do not have to use the chime mode. If you don't want the chime just leave it in alarm mode. If you want the door alarm to sound instantly when the door is open arm it with the left side switch set to home. The 30 second delay is only active with that switch set to away.

Reviews.Title: Easy install, pretty loud
Reviews.Author: jaison cherian
Reviews.Content: I got this system for my house, and I agree that this is a relly good product, I use the Chime a lot so that I'll know when the door opens when I'm upstairs but won't set off an alarm.. the alarm function is also pretty loud. I used the window system on the door as well and it works perfect. I would recoment this item to those who want an indication when a door or window is open and it does not come with monthly membership.

Reviews.Title: The Door alarm and Window alarm works separately
Reviews.Author: TKO "TKO"
Reviews.Content: Those who are buying this thinking that the door alarm and the window alarms works together in a full alarm system package like I did is wrong.The door alarm works just as the door alarm or chime and the 3 window alarm works separately from the whole system.  This is not a kit.  It's just 4 separate alarms/chimes.I do not suggest this kit if you are looking for an alarm kit.  This makes a great kit for 4 chimes.

Reviews.Title: Window alarms not very useful.
Reviews.Author: G. K.
Reviews.Content: The window alarms turn off when the window is closed again. Also they are not very loud, and not integrated with the door alarm.The alarm delay is too long. It would be easy to take the batteries out of the alarm in that time.However, this alarm system is a good deal for that price.

Reviews.Title: Decent product for the price
Reviews.Author: Sreema Vikanth "Skinny Guy"
Reviews.Content: Nice product. Alarm is pretty loud for a 2-bedroom apartment. Not sure if the smaller window alarms would be heard in bigger houses. One thing that took me sometime to figure out was - for the bigger unit, you would have to activate the alarm every time it is moved from Chime to Alarm mode. We use the chime mode during the day and the alarm mode during the night and it took me a while to figure out that the alarm had to be activated every night and de-activated every morning. This would help if that wasnt obvious to you.

Reviews.Title: Good basic deterrent
Reviews.Author: Matt S. "xmatt0926x"
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I needed to create a deterrent based on a couple recent break-ins and a guy caught exposing himself recently in my suburban development which by the way is just 500 yards from a police station. Go figure. Anyway, I've started to review the several home monitoring alarm companies but this may take a while to decide so I thought until then I will need at least some basic deterrents for my windows and doors. Here's what I feel so far after receiving these today. I really like the window alarms. They are really loud, install easily, and can be shut off entirely if wanted. Let's face it. All we can hope from an alarm is to scare a potential burglar away with a very loud noise. These will serve that purpose. One thing I wanted to dispute from other reviews here is the notion that window and window frame have to be exactly flush for these to work. Not the case! Yeah, they cant be really off, obviously, but mine are not flush by close to a 1/4 inch and they work fine. Bottom line is that if you are looking for something quick and basic, these will do the trick. After some research on alarm systems I feel it's debatable whether a system monitored by an offsite company really adds any benefit. Your ultimately hoping to scare the intruders into thin king the jig is up and they better split. These, coupled with some alarm signs for the lawn purchased seperately may be all most people need. By the way. As many have stated already, the door alarm is loud!!!

Reviews.Title: These would scare off any burgler unless he was deaf!
Reviews.Author: Joy Poteet "Joy Poteet, RN"
Reviews.Content: I recently found myself living alone in an apartment, and was not sleeping well for listening to sounds in and around the apartment. Never lived alone before but Hubby decided it was time to go through Male Menopause!!This pkg of alarms was so reasonably priced I thought I might as well give them a try. I absolutely love them!  I am fixing to look for more of just the ones for the windows since I have 2 more windows.I had them installed in under 15 minutes.  Each window took under a minute to install.  And you CAN NOT pull them off.  So make sure you know where you want them because they are going to stick where you put them.  The door alarm took a little more time to install since my door and frame were not flush but was easy to figure out. Don't forget to turn off the code in the morning before opening the door. It is so LOUD you are in a frenzy to get the code put in since it is killing your ears!  You only have to do that about twice (like I did) and you will remember it from then on.  Same goes with the windows.  Dont forget to turn them off before you open the window.  But at least there is not a code to put in on the windows.  Just start to raise them and they start squealing!  Also the fact they are not electric is great. No one can cut the wires to them from the outside of the house.I know this review sounds too good to be true, and no, I dont work for the company. They just do what they say!I HAVE TRULY NEVER FELT SAFER.

Reviews.Title: good investment
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Hamlin "jeeper"
Reviews.Content: I purchased for my daughter's apartment. She installed in minutes without tools, and feels comfortable knowing a breach will alert her to reach for her gun. Purchased another for my son!

Reviews.Title: A SMART ALARM FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: KissingBird "KissingBird"
Reviews.Content: I'AM SO PLEASE WITH THE ALARM SYSTEM! AT FIRST, I THOUGH FOR 20 DOLLARS I WAS GOING TO GET SOMETHING VERY CHEAP,BUT NO! IT WAS VERY EASY TO INSTALL, VERY EASY TO OPERATE, THE ONLY THING I WISH IT HAD ON IT WAS A VOLUME BUTTON FOR THE DOOR ALARM, IT IS SO LOUD ON THE CHIME SETTINGS WHICH COMES ON EVERY TIME THE DOOR OPEN AND SHUTS! SO IF YOU PLACE THE DOOR ALARM RIGHT BY YOUR HEAD ON THE DOOR FRAME AS YOU WALK IN BE PREPARED FOR THE LOUD CHIME IF THE ALARM ISNT SET!

Reviews.Title: Not working properly
Reviews.Author: CyberSaver
Reviews.Content: I've set up one window alarm and the front door alarm, but when I test by opening and closing the window and door, these alarms are not going off properly, most times they don't go off period, and it's quite frustrating. When I take them off the door and window, they chime or beep in my hand, but not at the place where they are suppose to chime and beep, the front door and the window! I've tried everything too, so that's not it. This thing is just not reliable, and I feel as though I've wasted my money. I was really hoping that this would work, and really like the keypad with code. Shame.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing...
Reviews.Author: Deep Nasta "in2deep"
Reviews.Content: Just got this in and my initial review isn't very good.  First of all, the sensors aren't connected with the keypad in any way.  Also, the instructions suggest mounting the keypad on the door itself which is difficult if the trim around your door is anything but flat. I was under the impression that this really was a wireless system and the sensors didn't have to be right next to the keypad.The window sensors/alarm are better.  They serve their intended purpose.  If a burglar breaks into your house, it will at least give you advance warning if you are home.  Yes, it can be easily disarmed but at least you have a head start.  I was actually hoping to use the additional sensors on my other doors but it doesn't look like that's going to happen unless I want to cut into my trim.I guess it's not bad for the price but all in all, it's not that great either.

Reviews.Title: Great little alarm
Reviews.Author: in Wilmington
Reviews.Content: I feel much safer having this alarm system.  I have a two story home with all the bedrooms upstairs.  I mounted these alarms on the doors and windows downstairs.  If the very loud alarms don't scare someone off, they will at least alert me to an intruder before they can make it up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: For the price, this is unbeatable
Reviews.Author: James "James S."
Reviews.Content: Very easy setup. PLENTY loud. Easy to use. replacement batteries for the window unit are relatively cheap for being a specialty battery. Window alarms are much quieter than the main alarm and they're not linked, but what do you expect for the money?

Reviews.Title: Very loud!
Reviews.Author: Angela Dandurand
Reviews.Content: I put this up with ease! A definate plus. It gives me piece of mind that I can hear someone enters, so therefore it gives me time to get my gun.

Reviews.Title: GE 51107 Smart home wireless alarm
Reviews.Author: MGK MURTY
Reviews.Content: The sound level is too less.It will not scare any intruder.It is useless as burglar alarm.May be we can use as a chime

Reviews.Title: works OK, but door system isn't very functional
Reviews.Author: D. Loo "11B"
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else says, you get what you pay for. System is OK for the price tag- window units aren't that loud, independent of each other and have an on/off switch, but they buy me time to reach for other items at my disposal if someone was trying to break in.Main concern is the door key pad, it doesn't always work unless the door is opened SLOWLY! What criminal, professional or otherwise, opens a door slowly 100% of the time?! Alas, like I stated earlier though, get what you pay for-works OK for an apartment, definitely don't get for a house.PS. If anyone knows how to fix the door issue I'm having, it would be much appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: does what it says
Reviews.Author: Doctor C
Reviews.Content: The window units as others have said are kind of lame since you can just close the window and the alarm goes off and there is an on/off switch for it!The door unit works very well.  I have a little trim around my door that puts a little gap between the magnet and the sensor and it still works.  It's also very loud.  Who knows whether this will actually stop someone breaking in but at the very least it'll startle him and even if he does take off with your plasma TV, his ears will be ringing for a while.

Reviews.Title: Works great, but directions are a little confusing.
Reviews.Author: Dawn
Reviews.Content: I live in a very safe apartment complex in an urban area and wanted a little extra peace of mind.These are very easy to install, just a matter of sticking the the adhesive to the back and to the wall/door/window.I really wanted a door alarm that had a code entry and delayed alarm. I also didn't want it to make a noise every time I opened the door, because it would drive my neighbors crazy. The directions weren't very clear on how to put it on silent.Basically there are 2 switches (1 on each side of the alarm). The left side is either home or away. The right side is alarm or chime.1. Home + alarm= Alarm sounds immediately when you open the door, you need to input the code to silence the alarm.2. Home + chime= High pitch, annoying, pretty loud chime, only chimes once.3. Away + alarm= Delayed alarm. You have to put in your code which "arms" the alarm, then the red light blinks for 45 seconds in which you can leave and shut the door. When you come back and open the door, it doesn't make any noises or blink or anything. You have 30 seconds to put your code in or the alarm sounds. After you put in your code, it's basically in silent mode, you can open and close the door to your hearts content, no alarms or chimes or codes. To "arm" the alarm again just put in your code.

Reviews.Title: A Simple Alarm for Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: Catalicious
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy and I am impressed by the intensity and volume of the alarm.We had an intruder in our back yard and prior to the police arriving he was tapping on my daughters window.  She became scared of her room because she worried someone might be able to open her window.  We talked with her about what might help her feel safe. One thing she suggested was an alarm that would sound if someone tried to open the window. I started looking for window alarms and found this package.  For three window alarms this package was very reasonably priced the bonus is the included door alarm that has a code to disarm.When the package arrived we tried out the alarms, the chime is very loud and simply signals once that the door has been opened. We can hear the chime from any room in the house if the windows are opened.  In the alarm setting there is a constant alarm until the window is closed. It is very loud and can even be heard by our neighbors (all of the plots in our neighborhood are about an acre so it is impressive that the neighbors can hear it). We do have attentive neighbors and they will call the police and investigate if they here an alarm.Though this is not a monitored alarm system (we live in a very rural area where there aren't many options on monitored systems and the ones available simply alert the police and unfortunately a call from an alarm company does not rank as a high priority call, though a call from a home owner that there is a trespasser will bring a very fast response.) the alarm is loud enough that it should scare off an intruder.  If you are only looking for something that will quietly chime to notify you that a door or window has opened this will be too loud for you.

Reviews.Title: A little deceiving but worth the money!
Reviews.Author: sam sneed
Reviews.Content: First off, I price this unit at lowes and it was $35 there so buy it here.  i was a little disappointed that this is not a wireless "system" as each unit works individually as another person stated.  So really if someone breaks in all they have to do is grab the unit and cover it with their hand to make it pretty quiet.  I can't imagine the neighbors will ever hear it if they burglar is halfway intelligent.There needs to be a volume control on the chime mode.  I can't believe how freakin loud it is.  I would almost rather use the units without the keypad for the front door as they are simple and have an off feature.  I like to use one for the back door as I just flip the switch to alarm every night after letting the dog out.  I keep the front door one on chime for now as i don't want to mess with the loud key pad.I was only going to give this product 3 stars until today (I've had for 3 days)  I'm home alone with my almost four year old and I go to the restroom today and am not even in there 2 minutes when I hear the front door chime go off.  So I freaked and ran to the door.  She says she just wanted to see outside.  True or not, I'd say this product has and will pay for itself with having small children in the house.

Reviews.Title: they do the job
Reviews.Author: RichA
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned, these are really loud.  They do exactly what they say they do.  The only advice I would give is that if you do use these on your front door, that you maybe put it at the bottom of the door instead of the top right where your guest's heads will be when they come or go.  They are loud enough to cause a bit of a scare if you're not used to them.

Reviews.Title: Loud Little Thing!
Reviews.Author: A. Scharfenberger
Reviews.Content: I bought a set of these last week after my elderly neighbor was broken into. After an afternoon of research, I decided on these since they were not permanently installed (apartment living), small, and relatively inexpensive. I wanted something that would make enough noise that it would alert me that there was a problem, but did not require a phone line for service since I only use a cell phone. They were very easy to install by myself and took about 15 minutes from start to finish, including testing and reading the instructions. I would suggest these to anyone that wanted an inexpensive alarm system for an apartment.

Reviews.Title: Does the job as stated
Reviews.Author: Bhargav Raval
Reviews.Content: Nice security system which would probably the best at this price range. Window Alarm is loud enough but the best alarm is the door. Must buy if you dont want to pay for the pricey calling features or monthly services.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Lutea
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and work quite well. We use it more like a child prove device since they tend to open doors and windows on their own.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't always work
Reviews.Author: Basketmaker "Reader"
Reviews.Content: I purchased enough door and window alarms to arm my entire ranch house. Arranged to have my handyman come over to install the system. We opened everything, installed batteries, etc. When it was time to mount the units he discovered that with my type windows (old with aluminum frames), there is no way they will work. My house is not unique. In my area all the houses were built this way. No where on the packaging did it stipulate what type of windows you could use the product on. We brainstormed everything we could think of but they just don't work. I'm sure it's a nice product if you can use it. I just wish the company would tell you certain types of windows aren't able to accomodate the units.

Reviews.Title: Does not work!
Reviews.Author: Thanh bui
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst product I have bought on Amazon! The sensor requires to be within millimeters in order for the sensor and sound to be activated!  It says on the manual that it needs to be half inch or less in order for the sensor to be detected... However, this is much worst then advertise.  Does not work as advertised, save your money and get something else.I purchased it due to the raving reviews, however, the sensitivity of this item needs to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get them to work
Reviews.Author: Pep
Reviews.Content: OK, the alarms are fairly piercing, but that doesn't do you any good if you can't get them to work. I installed the main alarm on the door of my daughter's apartment but couldn't get it to work, once it was installed. It appears that the sensors need to be nearly touching and exactly in alignment. The only time I could get it to work was when I was holding the sensors next to each other in my hands.

Reviews.Title: It's freaking LOUD!!!!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: Isn't that the point?  It's LOUD!!!  I am very happy with it.  Easy to follow directions and oh so easy to install.  I ordered extra window alarms and they are loud enough.  Nobody is going to know that it's not hard wired to a system.  All they will see is the blinking light, then WOWZA that alarm!so for less than $50 I have alarms on all my windows and doors. It makes plenty of noise and will attract plenty of attention.  The window alarms aren't too loud, but they are loud enough and I even set mine up so the magnet strip and the unit are at right angles to each other.  Works great.All in all, I am very happy with them.

Reviews.Title: Scared me to death
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: While staying at my son's apartment, I didn't know that he had set the alarm upon leaving one morning.  I opened the door, and just about had a heart attack.  I didn't know the code to turn it off, so I had to call him and find out the code.  Of course, he thought that is was hilarious, I was scared to death.  I am purchasing some for my home.  Needless to say, this works well.

Reviews.Title: It does what it is supposed to do
Reviews.Author: BeringStrait123
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to install. I just used the sticker enclosed to attach them to wood doors and Vinyl window. The sound is high enough. It does what a $25 alarm suite is supposed to do. I've NO complaints.

Reviews.Title: Recommended & Worth the Price
Reviews.Author: Steve C. Michalski "Stevix©"
Reviews.Content: This isn't the best alarm system but it is inexpensive, easy to set up and really noisy.  I would say that it would scare away an amateur thief and gives me some peace of mind when I'm away..

Reviews.Title: The window alarms are fine
Reviews.Author: L. Short
Reviews.Content: While this is a great idea, there is no off button for the door alarm. Every time you open the door, the chime sounds at a minimum. In addition, you can't just leave your door open. There is no off button. That was not indicated in the materials. The window alarms do have an off button. They would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: good for what it is
Reviews.Author: xyz
Reviews.Content: what it is is a cheap alarm set. It works as described. Be careful with the door switches though, they're very cheap plastic and one of the sliders broke inside, so that one can only chime now, not alarm. That said, the alarm is pretty freaking loud and shrill! exactly what I wanted in an alarm.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Security
Reviews.Author: Colt Kindall
Reviews.Content: I live in a three level town house, and I am always worried that I will not be able to hear if someone breaks in through my door or window on the bottom floor.  With this, I can sleep much better.  The door alarm is VERY LOUD, but the windows ones aren't quite as loud.  I would recommend this for someone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Loud adequate warning
Reviews.Author: Think
Reviews.Content: This item dThis item does exactly what home security alarms do with the exception of contacting emergency responders. It is very very loud. If you're looking for something to alert you while in the home, this is perfect. If you're looking to have the home monitored while you're away, then you have to be willing to pay the monthly bill and installation fee. The product is excellent. I actually plan on procuring more. Highly recommend. Gives you enough warning pending location to get to whatever you own to protect your family. For LEGAL LAW ABIDING firearm owners I imagine this is perfect for them.

Reviews.Title: Nice home alarm
Reviews.Author: Thee~Classy~Gal
Reviews.Content: I rated Smart home Wireless Alarm System kit 4 stars because it is a good home alarm. This was easy to set up and use right away. We have the key pad alarm on the main door and the smaller window alarm one on the back door.Tip: make sure you switch to "away" before you leave the house because if you leave it on "home" it will set off the alarm as soon as you open the door. I've had that done a few times and my ears were seriously hurting. I have it on " home setting" at night.Overall, this is an inexpensive home alarm that works well and provides you with safer nights!

Reviews.Title: Broken and door edge issues
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Really does not work ... I tried attaching it but my door has a little round curve so it could not hit magnet but even then I tested it myself and seems broken.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY THIS CHEAP STUFF YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR,,JUNK
Reviews.Author: anthony frye
Reviews.Content: I had 2 buy batters no manual for it.and the so called key pad dont do anything other lights up AND make sound ..you get what you pay for cheap peace of junk,sorry but thats how i feel..i know how to use it after amazon sent me a copy of a manual emailed.i thought i was doing something wrong with it but i was not..WOULD NOT TELL ANYONE TO BUY THIS..

Reviews.Title: Got a defective unit
Reviews.Author: Orbs
Reviews.Content: The chime mode works, but the alarm does not work at all.  It is disappointing, but I had to return it because I bought this item for its alarm feature.

Reviews.Title: buy a better adhesive
Reviews.Author: Twenty something
Reviews.Content: It worked exactly as described until it fell because the tape they sent with it failed. Now I feel like I wasted my money :/

Reviews.Title: GE Smart Home Wireless Kit
Reviews.Author: Mustang
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and set up!  Having been in the security business for most of my life, "presence" is 80-90% of the battle, and seeing these on the windows and doors from the outside provide 1) a good deterrent and 2) a "humbling" alarm sound if activated.  A determined perpetrator will ignore this type of alarm just like they would any other alarm, but for 95% of would be perps, this system is an inexpensive way to shut them down in their tracks before they even get to the point of being able to harm anyone or steal anything!

Reviews.Title: Cheap and functional
Reviews.Author: who cares
Reviews.Content: Good starter kit for a little peace of mind.  Won't replace a real wired kit and home monitoring, but is a good deterrent.

Reviews.Title: Bummer... =(
Reviews.Author: N. Reeves
Reviews.Content: Well, I read all the reviews and decided to give it a shot since it is one of Amazon's best-sellers, though I think that is only because it's cheaper than other sets out there. Anyway, I bought three sets and I put them all up the day they arrived. Here is what I found...1. Sound - the door sensors are far louder than the window sensors, so depending on your needs, this may or may not work for you. The chime and alarm on the window sensors are also about the same volume, unlike the door sensor. The door sensor's volume is significantly louder during the door's alarm than it is for the door chime. In hindsight, if solely based on volume, I would prefer to use door sensors for the windows instead. It's hard to hear the window alarm from the other room if the house isn't dead silent (meaning, if you're watching a football game or playing with the kids.. you may not hear it at all).2. Placement - I chose to use the double-sided tape since I may be moving soon. The double-sided tape works well for most of the sensors if the surface is completely flat or glass. On the painted wood in my doorway, I found it not to be so strong, so I went and bought a stronger adhesive for the doorway. On my windows, the tape stuck very well to the glass and only one of them has fallen down on it's own thus far. The one that fell was in the sun and within a humid room, so my guess is that the sun's heat and room's humidity affected the tape somehow? Other than that, placing them was easy and the instructions on house to do so were simple.3. Practical? - Mmm, only if you understand that this is simply a warning or "heads up" that should be supplemented otherwise. I strongly discourage anyone from using this as their sole "warning" system of any kind since I have found it to be unreliable so far (see below) however it's a good addition to your home when it works or if you can keep it working somehow. For the sake of testing it out, I played devil's advocate on one in my room and tried to see how easy it is to remove if I were a burglar. Well, these aren't too hard to yank off the windows, and it is foolishly easy to, even accidentally, remove the battery panel where the batteries are located and knock just one battery out..which shuts the entire alarm OFF instantly. Like I said...you'll need a backup. OK, for chime-use only if that is all you need it for, but for burglar-alerts, not so much. However...4. Quality and Performance... Both are lacking. The plastic is cheap and the battery covers on the window sensors can be accidentally removed far too easily. The battery test is also faulty too. They all tested bright green when I first opened the package and the product claims these batteries should last awhile... but a couple of mine lasted no more than a few hours. I had put those two window sensors up in the hall and later one went off, making noises much like that of a toy running out of battery power. Then it just died.. so I tested the other, and the other one's light wouldn't turn green and the sensor wouldn't make noise at all when I opened the window. This was frustrating for me because I tested every single sensor's placement (meaning I made sure it was no more than the designated width apart) before and after installing them - and then I tested them all on alarm and chime mode by opening the doors and windows they were placed upon. Most of them have no gap at all and were working fine earlier! And worse still, the chime function works only sometimes. I have completely opened and closed my doors and windows a few times and if I do it about 5 times in a row, it will make a noise 3 of the five times. And this morning, I thought I had forgotten to set me door alarm because it didn't go off when the door opened, so I put in my code and tried testing it and it still wouldn't go off. So I switched it to "chime" and it went off after a try or two, so I went back to "alarm" and put in my code...and THEN it worked. So, like I said, great concept and these would be acceptable if they were reliable... Heaven forbid anyone ever comes into our home that shouldn't but I don't feel any sort of confidence in this product knowing this kit might or might not work to alert me.I will give these another day (buying new batteries and going to retest them all) and will write an update as to whether they get worse or better...  major bummer since I really wanted these to be good. And for anyone with kids or loved ones... we all know that a product like this that only works "sometimes" isn't good enough. It only takes ONE incident where a chime or alarm doesn't go off to be the difference between knowing if your kid is safely inside or not.. So please, don't rely solely on these if that's what you are using them for!

Reviews.Title: This is crap-don't buy them!
Reviews.Author: Bonita Eaton
Reviews.Content: Would like to have something which actually can be set and stay set for safety. Code does not stay and you never know when it needs re-setting. Directions were not complete either.

Reviews.Title: Good, but needs some simple improvement
Reviews.Author: OVUgirl08
Reviews.Content: The alarms are easy to install and work well.  Two problems with the larger alarm: (1) There is no indicator on the alarm to show whether it is armed or not. The only way to know is to either open the door which if it is armed will set off the screaching alarm, or (2) to enter the code and see if it is "On" or "off."  It needs an indicator to show if it is on or not.  (2) the other issue with the alarm is that if someone breaks in, the alarm is attached with just hooks and can be taken  off and stomped, thus ending the alarm.  It needs to be changed to be screwed on or attached with double sided tape.The smaller alarms are attached with double sided tape and thus cannot be easily removed.  The problem with the small alarm is that as soon as the door or window is closed the alarm shuts off.  It should stay on until it is reset (thus it needs a reset button,which it does not presently have).Overall, I can recommend these alarms, maybe 7 or 8 out of 10.  They need some simple additions, then I could rate them 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: It has been working great for the past two years
Reviews.Author: übung
Reviews.Content: I have been using it for the past two years with great results.Batteries last very long and so far it has been working very good and people keep asking me where i bought it.

Reviews.Title: alarm
Reviews.Author: jean ratay
Reviews.Content: you should get these they work and do the job that needed to be fullfilled, its scares the crap out people if they're not paying attention, love it!!! please buy........

Reviews.Title: new apartment
Reviews.Author: Anne-Marie
Reviews.Content: My daughter rented a new apartment in the city and wanted something to alert her if someone messed with her doors and windows. She ran a check on these and said that they trigger and work quickly and loudly.

Reviews.Title: Great product, not what I thought though.
Reviews.Author: Student1
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are correct when they say the siren is loud. However, I bought this for my town home so that I would be notified if someone were to break in on the first floor when I'm on the third. Its not loud enough for that and the siren will only go off in the location that it was set-off. So for my purposes, it doesn't work. But I do think the product is great for a small apartment setting or any one floor home (possible a small 2-floor).

Reviews.Title: Helps my girlfriend feel safer at home.
Reviews.Author: Timothy6216
Reviews.Content: I really liked this alarm system. It was easy to install and program the door alarms. It took a few days to get used to having an alarm system, and at first I didn't realize the difference between the "alarm set flashes" and the "recently entered the home and needs to be deactivated flashes" so it would go off about a half minute after walked out the door. But after I used it for a bit and waited a minute outside my door the first few times to make sure it wouldn't go off, I feel much more comfortable in my home with it there and I now know the difference in the flashes and don't need to wait. The door alarms are very loud and would definitely wake me up, the window alarms on the other hand are not very loud and would probably not wake me up at night (which is the reason for the four star rating), but if someone were to try and break in and heard the window alarms I am sure they would help deter someone from continuing to enter my home.Also something important to note about the alarms, the door alarm is loud and will continue to ring until you turn it off. The window alarms are relatively faint and will turn off once the window is shut.

Reviews.Title: Very LOUD alarm set!
Reviews.Author: minami
Reviews.Content: As many has said, this alarm set is extremely LOUD!!! Especially the door alarm. I feel much more secure with these alarms at home. The three window alarms will stop alarming if you close the door, so as some customer has said, this could be a drawback. However with such a cheap price, I really cannot complain more. Besides, the door alarm is really effective, and once the alarm is set, it cannot be stopped unless you enter the 4-digit pin. I'm happy with this purchase and hopefully it could guard my apartment.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for money you pay!!
Reviews.Author: Ram
Reviews.Content: We live in an apartment on the ground floor and always feel unsafe. I did some research and finally zeroed in on this product. The one meant for the main door with a code is loud as hell. So be careful while testing it. The 3 small ones for the windows are loud considerably too. My wife sleeps better knowing that we have this in place. It can easily scare the petty thieves away.If you want peace of mind with less money spending, then this is a great buy i would say.

Reviews.Title: great for what it is
Reviews.Author: Adam Richards "that dude"
Reviews.Content: These are not home security systems, they will not alert the police or alert any hub who will assist you... These will startle any intruder and give a resident forwarning that they may be in danger. The noise is loud and will arouse you from your sleep and certainly wake neighbors if close by.  For what they cost they are effective and easy to install and set.For my home i live in a small town with apartments and townhouses in close proximity.  They work great!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Gadgets
Reviews.Author: Nbosancu
Reviews.Content: Really great alarm systme for thoes of us who dont want to spend hundred on a real one.. Screws for mounting came with my kit...and that double sided tape it VERY strong (I didn't use the screws)...I placed one of my alarms and decided to change its position and it was very difficult to remove. The alarms are sooooo LOUD! Almost went def! Even the chime is loud, I prefer not to use it as to not drive the nieghbors nuts! Very great little system, I couldn't imagine a robber/theif just jumping through and closing the window behind him/her. The loud alarm is enough to scare them away in most cases. Unless they are a very expirenced super theif, in which case they wouldn't be robbing a home like yours and mine---We are too cheap to buy a REAL security system, therefore not rich...therefore not worth a super theif's time...just for a small dvd collection and maybe a few small things....just sayin'. Super theifs probably will use their super abilities on a rich home....normal theifs that would try to rob our normal sized homes would not jump through the window and then close it...they couldn't tell the difference betwen out cheap alarm system and a real one, they have no way of knowing our systems dont dial 911....unless they are a super theif!!!Works great, haven't had any problems with them...

Reviews.Title: Big time security for budget price
Reviews.Author: debbie0413
Reviews.Content: The security alarm kit I bought is perfect for the security at our small business.  Back in early November, 2011 we were shocked to find out that our small computer business was burglarized one night.  The thief took a total of 5 used laptops (one of them belonging to our office manager) as well as my best DV camcorder & cables.  The glass had been broken out of our front door, so that is why I chose this alarm kit.  It consists of 2 window alarms and 1 door/window alarm/chime.  I put 2 of the window alarm devices on the glass on our back door, 1 on the replaced & reinforced glass on our front door, and the door chime on the front door.  Each of the alarms consists of 2 parts: a unit about the size of your thumb and another piece the size of your pinky finger.  You affix the window alarms so that if the glass is broken, a VERY LOUD (120 db) alarm sounds constantly until until you physically place the switch in the "off" position.  I use the door alarm/chime as the chime function, since my husband is partially deaf and benefits from the chime to alert him to a customer entering the store.  The only reason I did not give this product 5 stars is that I was NOT able to get the door unit to sound with the alarm function.  It may be that I did not wait long enough after I set the password for it to sound.  Using this unit as a chime works better for us than constantly arming and disarming an alarm, so I did not bother to call the ocmpany about instructions to get that function to work.I don't think that this alarm kit is the total answer for detering burglars, but it is a good start.  Prior to buying this kit, I beefed up our door security by installing deadbolts that require a key on both sides rather than the less secure, 1 key variety we previously had.  I also plan to get door security grilles in the near future to provide additional security.  That way, a burglar will have to literally take the door off the hinges to break in.  If they first try to pry the door open and then break the glass, our security alarms will sound and alert neighbors & police while they scare the thief away!

Reviews.Title: got this for my autistic son who kept getting out of the house
Reviews.Author: Jennibutch
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my six year old son is an escape artist. It was getting to the point where I could not leave him alone, he would wander out the front or side door. This alarm is really simple to set up. I am a single mother and did not want to deal with some crazy system that I would have to drill into walls or wire up. It took less than half an hour and you can not beat the price! It's really simple to use. I chose the door that leads outside (i have three) that was farthest away from the living and bedroom to put the real door alarm on(the others are actually window alarms but work on doors great). the window alarms will shut off once the door (or window)is shut again but the door alarm will not, you have to put the code in to shut it down. the alarm is loud and will get your attention for sure! Great buy it works perfect for what i needed.

Reviews.Title: GE 51107 WIreless Alarm
Reviews.Author: Malone Cakes
Reviews.Content: I'm 1/2 & 1/2 on this one because the one's on my window work great, I have 1 on each and when opened the alarm is very loud you can hear it threw out my complex but these don't fit on my door due to the way the shape of the front door is designed, I tried to place them in many different directions (So it's not there fault it's just the door design because the other's work perfectly)..Thanks

Reviews.Title: It is what it is and it does what it says it does.
Reviews.Author: Daniel R. Dreifort "REVIEW-BOT-9000"
Reviews.Content: I use these in conjunction with OTHER security measures. These alone might scare off some prowlers, but if you really want to be secure you'll enact additional protocols. Combine these with a few cameras hooked up to a DVR and a motion sensor plugged into a phone line, oh, and a gun - then you're good to go.

Reviews.Title: Works like a Pro
Reviews.Author: I'labocher
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this product before purchasing it.  All the reviews were very favorable. I placed my order on Oct 13th and received it Oct 18th, I briefly read over the instructions and everything was installed in 10 minutes. I like the fact that I could use the window alarms on the doors, I have 3 doors on the downstairs level they Work perfectly. The chime is loud enough to be beard through out the house, the alarm sounds like a car alarm. I let my friend listen to the sound over the phone she couldn't believe how strong and steady the sound was. I was so impressed with the performance and price, I'm placing an order for her now.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly loud and easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Julie Glavic
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how anyone could beat this for the price. It's simple to set up and incredibly loud. It has two settings: "chime" and "alarm". I tested it on "chime", not wanting to disturb my neighbors in our triplex. Even the "chime" was super loud and annoying. Maybe it wouldn't wake up neighbors in a next-door building, but it'll certainly alert the neighbors who share a wall with us. (My dog absolutely hated the noise; she's not usually very intimidating but maybe if this noise set her off a burglar wouldn't find her as friendly as usual.) I liked that the two parts of the alarm don't have to quite be touching, since the way our doors and windows are framed necessitate the parts of the alarm to be a little bit apart from one another. No, it's not a centralized alarm system. No, it won't stop a deaf burglar from entering your house. No, it won't tar and feather intruders like the "alarm" system in Home Alone. But if you want a very affordable and very loud alarm that can be set for home or for away, here it is.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: FOR THE MONEY, this is an outstanding product.  Nothing fancy, no off-site monitoring, but now the 2 doors and 2 windows in my apartment will shriek if the alarm is armed and door/window is opened.  If I'm asleep, I reach for the bright flashlight and gun next to my bed, close and lock my bedroom door and call 911 on either my wired or cell phone (both also bedside).  Leave the phone open with the operator until the police arrive (so my defensive actions are taped for possible later use in any trial) and use the gun as a last resort if my life is in immediate danger.  Remember, when seconds count, the police are only minutes away.  If I'm not home, the bad guy will get the same irritating noise and hopefully still run to a less protected home.  Either way, for less than 25 bucks, I am safer.

Reviews.Title: Great alarm for a good price.
Reviews.Author: Panorz
Reviews.Content: This is a real nice alarm. It is pretty loud and easy to install. it has a home mode where it goes off instantly and a away mode that has a timed setting. its not going to call your phone or a alarm company but it will make someone think twice about sticking around if it goes off.

Reviews.Title: Product works as expected
Reviews.Author: Sudhin
Reviews.Content: The product works as expected. The only thing is the On-Off switch on the alarms, which you can turn off if the alarm goes on. Not sure if this is good or bad feature.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Inexpensive Alarm System
Reviews.Author: Shilly
Reviews.Content: There were a few break ins nearby, so I just wanted something that I could use that would make a noise if someone opened a back window. This set is inexpensive and does exactly what I wanted.Takes a few seconds to attach to window and is loud enough to scare the heck out of an intruder or wake me up if I am home when it goes off. The GE 51107 Smart Home Wireless Alarm System Kit is inexpensive and flexible. You can use one or all of the items, or add to it if you need more.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mattissama
Reviews.Content: I have these installed in my apartment. I can sleep easily at night since I know I will be alerted if anyone breaks in! They were very easy to install and they are nice and loud.

Reviews.Title: Good buy !!
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I rate this only a 4 **** as one of the window alarm worked properly for just 1 day then would constantly alarm until I just discarded it. Overall, a good buy but would only use for samll spaces such as an apartment, then the alarm would be heard, otherwise as a house alarm the sound would not be loud enough to be heard.

Reviews.Title: Works like it says
Reviews.Author: nana
Reviews.Content: Only one of my monitors didn't work out of the package. Instead of sending it back I just used the other 3 monitors. Easy setup and very loud.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for our needs
Reviews.Author: SCmom
Reviews.Content: This alarm system was perfect for our needs.  We decided to use the window alarms on our sliding door and door to our garage, as I felt I wanted the doors secured most.  They work perfectly there.  Also, our bedroom is downstairs but the kids are upstairs, so I always worried that I wouldn't hear an intruder come in and go up.  There is no missing the sound of this alarm!  If it doesn't instantly scare someone away (which I think it would), it will at least alert us that someone has broken in.  I also use the chime system during the day which is perfect w/ two toddlers so I'll always know if someone has opened a door.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price!
Reviews.Author: Vi Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Got this 6 months ago and its been working perfectly. It was very easy to put together and made us feel safer. Perfect for an apt complex.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: BobKat "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Good buy for the money. My in-law has dementia and wanders at night. The window alarms are enough to alert us if she opens an Exterior door. The bigger alarm if mounted on the exterior door will wake up the neighbors.All the alarms do have a Alarm or Chime Switch choice. The 3 smaller window alarms are not as loud. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Good System
Reviews.Author: James A. McClelland
Reviews.Content: This is a good system for those who live in an apartment or who does not want to pay a fee every month to have a security system. Very very easy to set up. I suggest you purchase the home security sighs as well. It will complete the package.

Reviews.Title: Good deterrant
Reviews.Author: Niharika Kamat
Reviews.Content: I use the GE alarm system as a deterrant for any intruders. It surely does not have any fancy security features, but the loud noise will surely drive anyone trying to break in away! The alarms for the windwos however, could not be placed on my specific sliding doors and windows. Overall,  this basic system serves its purpose of maiking a loud annoying noise to drive people away.

Reviews.Title: Simple, cheap, and handy security system
Reviews.Author: Ashutosh Tamhane "A Tamhane"
Reviews.Content: I bought a GE SmartHome Wireless Alarm System Kit #51107.  I already have a professional security system.  This was an addition for the windows especially for nights.  This system is very easy to install and dependable (at least so far ~ 1 month).  The sound is large and sharp enough that one would hear in sleep and can be heard in other rooms  (would vary depending upon the house).  Would surely recommend this product. The delivery was quick and the product was securely packed.

Reviews.Title: Very good system for the price.
Reviews.Author: Steviehuy
Reviews.Content: This is a good system if you're trying to look for a cheaper alternative to a real alarm system.  It's very easy to install.  The only thing I would like it to have is maybe some kind of indication that the alarm (in Home mode) is on.  Sometimes I forget that I had set the alarm the night before and open my door and the alarm goes off!  But the sound is very loud, considering it's a small unit.  (Enough to scare any thief away and your immediate neighbor to hear.)Also, my husband actually suggests that I carry the smaller window alarm piece with me when I walk at night so when I need help I can trigger the alarm with the switch. :)Best of all is the price.  You get a peace of mind for just $25!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: L. Tatman
Reviews.Content: Good product, easy to install (even for my handyman challenged husband!)My only issue is that the window alarms are almost too loud.

Reviews.Title: Good for small apartments.....
Reviews.Author: MMMendy
Reviews.Content: My husband deployed and I was going to be all alone in my apartment for a whole year and so I got these for extra safety measures...I live in a one bedroom apartment so these are ideal for small homes...the window alarms aren't too loud but the door alarm is...and they're toy-like..it made me feel safer though because I'd be alerted if someone was breaking into my home.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat pleased
Reviews.Author: My "Skeptical Eco-modernist"
Reviews.Content: The product seems easy to use, except for the big bulky one with the code. They don't seem to interact with each other at all. So the door/window alarms are great, but the big bulky thing, I couldn't get it to work, so 3 out 4 items work, so it's moderately okay.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Money gets you a basic intrusion alert system
Reviews.Author: Ron Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Well, if you don't need or care about a monitored theft prevention system, and are looking for a basic night time intrusion detection alarm, how can you anyone beat the price on this?  For short money you've got yourself an instant on intrusion alarm for you and your family!  People who own a firearm for self defense but don't invest in a good intrusion alarm are fooling themselves.

Reviews.Title: good for windows...
Reviews.Author: buyer
Reviews.Content: The chime in these is very Loud. The door alarm has this tiny screw that will not come out so you can put in batteries. Even with my tiniest screw driver it ended up striping the screw. You basically have to break the back off to put in batteries. The front door alarm doesn't give you and option to turn off like the window ones. That chime is very loud but besides that it's ok for a cheap alarm. I would recommend it for windows and look elsewhere for front door

Reviews.Title: Worst customer service at GE, don't waste your time & money ...
Reviews.Author: Dev Bisesar
Reviews.Content: If I can give a 0 I would just because the customer service for GE sucks... I received my package on time. As am trying to put everything together, I notice that the main alarm with the key pad require a small screwdriver. I had the right size but I've tried for 20 minutes trying to open the battery compartment which was impossible. What happen then cause the screws to strip but still couldn't get in.I called the manufacturer, I get this very rude & tired woman on the phone. I explain the situation to her, she first was telling me something that has nothing to do with what I ask. Then I repeated myself & her suggestion was " I can break it to get it open" wtf !!!! I paid $$ for that. She then said there aren't responsible for that.I just decided to return the product & got my money back. She was no help & reflect bad on GE because they couldn't come up with a better solution ...Do not waste your money ...

Reviews.Title: Works great and makes me sleep better!
Reviews.Author: Charlene Burke
Reviews.Content: I live in a large complex and wanted to feel a bit more secure. So i got this to give it a try and wow it is loud and it works! I sometimes forgets it is on when i open the door LOL. This was worth it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: I love this system for the price I paid for everything to cover all my door & windows is what a monthly subscription would have cost me and I am not locked into a 1-3 year contract either. When I tested this system when I got it the noise is so loud & piercing that it gave me an instant headache so I was like, "yes it works". This is one of the best purchases I have ever made!!!

Reviews.Title: easy and very loud
Reviews.Author: DINA BARKIN
Reviews.Content: The alarm is easy to put on and very loud, although it is only us have been tripping it so far.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: AZ
Reviews.Content: Easy installation, acceptable alarm sound, compact and discreet design time to install, easy to program the key to the main station, fast delivery

Reviews.Title: Great little starter set!
Reviews.Author: John R Kucharski
Reviews.Content: So simple, even a .... see you're already offended!  These are simple and inexpensive.  If you (or your daughter) lives alone... or with her son, it's a perfect intrusion alarm (Loud and annoying) anyone can afford and operate.  Door Chime, Alarm, and Off switch makes it simple.  No one sneaks in.... young boy can't sneak out.  No it's not not "centrally monitored", but I don't care what happens when they are NOT there... just when they are!

Reviews.Title: Easy to install
Reviews.Author: L. Gundersen
Reviews.Content: This is a great all round simple set of alarms to place on one door and three windows. Setting them up is simple, they come with the batteries and adhesive for sticking on. The door alarm has a home and away mode so that you have time to close the door. The alarm is very loud!

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and VERY loud
Reviews.Author: S.T.
Reviews.Content: I was actually surprised how loud the door alarm is!  I am pretty sure they heard it several houses down this morning when my daughter forgot to put the code in before opening the door. ;) I was able to get these mounted in no time. I like the chime too for the "home" setting. I am going to order another set for the back door and more windows! You can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Safety first
Reviews.Author: sunwukong
Reviews.Content: Protect your family.Make your life more protection.Easy to operate.Relatively more powerful.And very easy to install.The family is essential safety equipment.

Reviews.Title: Nice sense of security
Reviews.Author: a normal girl
Reviews.Content: I bought this system after reading many reviews. I live on the first floor of an apartment complex and I've always felt a little uneasy being there by myself. I do have two dogs but I wanted even more of a deterrent to potential burglars. The alarms were pretty easy to set up and the code is easily changed by removing the back and resetting if needed. The alarms are extremely ear piercing (great for when you need it - not so great for when you thought you had turned off the alarm). It took us a few tries (and losing our hearing a few times) to get it right - one beep means it's armed; two beeps means it's off. If you remember that, you're golden. I highly recommend this product if you cannot afford a monitored system.

Reviews.Title: Cheap product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tinkerbell411"
Reviews.Content: Cheap product that is really iffy on when it will work and very touchy. You have to go to the store to buy special batteries for the window alarms.

Reviews.Title: Door alarm not a good fit with molding
Reviews.Author: Griff in Boston
Reviews.Content: The door alarm does not fit with doors that have molding around them.  USed the window alarms though and they seem fine.

Reviews.Title: Quick, Easy, Alarm System
Reviews.Author: Larry Fraley
Reviews.Content: The small door/window chime alarms work very well--chiming each time the door is opened.  The door must be closed to assure functionality of the alarm as the alarm does not work if the door is ajar and then opened.  Easy to install.

Reviews.Title: What a waste of $20
Reviews.Author: Gokay
Reviews.Content: Pretty useless. The double-sided tape does not stick and the alarms keep falling off, creating many annoying false alarms. After two days, I quit using them. The door alarm is a joke as well. For anybody that breaks in through the door, it would take less than 2 seconds to disable the alarm.

Reviews.Title: Awesome security system!!!
Reviews.Author: Veltiana
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure this system would work for us, but I can tell you that it did.  It is easy to install and easy to set the code to set the alarm on and off.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PRODUCT !!
Reviews.Author: Paulette D.
Reviews.Content: Good Product !!  Easy to Install and adds a little extra peace of mind while away from home.  Of course, it is not a fail-safe, but a feel-safe deterrant for a nervous thief who doesn't want to be heard by a close neighbor, which means you will be a little less stressed, at least, while you are out or as a warning system, while you are home.  Fairly inexpensive and worth the price. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Smart Home Wireless Alarm System is better than getting a fancy home alarm that you have to pay the bill every month
Reviews.Author: Elaine Weir
Reviews.Content: Price Right - easy to install - easy to use - alarm is loud and can be heard from across the house.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: I am 57 yr old woman living alone and found these alarms very easy to install and operate.  I especially like the home/away switch that allows me to set the alarm with or without a delay.  There is also a chime setting to know when the door is opened.  If this alarm does not send an intruder running it will at least give me time to take action.  I am very pleased and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Only needed the door alarm part.
Reviews.Author: Robbie  Nagy "bob-0"
Reviews.Content: I only hooked up the door alarm part of this package set.  My wife is a home based worker and I wanted her to have a "warning" if anyone was trying to get in our kitchen door; which is shielded from the street by our enclosed poarch.  There have been a few 'daylight' break ins within the township and this would help my wife [or myself if it happens at night] not be surprised!  Seems to work so far as I have tested.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: This is a great idea but it did not work for me.  You must have a flat door frame in order for these to be mounted and I do not.  Had to return because of this.

Reviews.Title: AWesome!
Reviews.Author: MandaPanda5
Reviews.Content: Bought these after I kicked my x out and LOVE THEM. I feel safe when i'm not home because the alarm is loud and my neighbors will here it and when i'm home because even when you open the door you still hear a beep to indicate the door has been open. Great Buy Great Price!

Reviews.Title: simple alarm for fraction of the price
Reviews.Author: POPONG
Reviews.Content: When my niece with Down Syndrome went wandering out of the house, I immediately looked this up on Amazon. It's a great product! Very loud and very discreet.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: zoo
Reviews.Content: This alarm is very loud. Perfect for what i needed. If you want cheap security this is the one you want. If you have more then one door you will want to order two sets of these. the window units stop alarming when they are reclosed, the door alarm doesn't.

Reviews.Title: Had it for two months now and it still works
Reviews.Author: Emily Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a great product if you do not want to invest in an expensive monthly payment to the security company.  It has an easy to read direction on how to install it.  The main purpose of this kit is to ALERT people in the home who just opened windows/door and to SCARE off possible intruders.  It by no means tells you if an intruder has entered your home.  For example, you can have the device under CHIME, so whenever you open the door, it means one loud noise.  And if you set the device as ALARM, once you open the door, it'll keep on making loud noises until you close the door then the noise stops.  So, if the intruder opens and closes the door and yeah your alarm just went off until the door got closed, you have no way of knowing if the intruder is in your home.  So like I said, the main purpose of this kit is to ALERT the people at your home when coming in or out of the house and to SCARE off possible intruders.
