Reviews.Title: GE 51107 Smart Home Wireless Alarm System Kit
Reviews.Author: AlexG
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something simple to set up, and functional and browsing through amazon for Alarm products came upon this one because of the high ranking and good reviews.The product comes with 4 alarm modules, 3 for windows and 1 for the doors, btw the picture makes it seem much bigger or at least it did for me, in real life they are small even the key module.The product is easy to set up, the best part id, it contains everything you will need except 3 AAA batteries but aside from that everything. It so simple to use, you will have it installed in minutes. Also the door module comes in with features like "Home" and "Away" that should come in handy when you need different set up modes.The noise it makes is pretty loud, enough to wake you up at night and get you to react. Note that this alarm system is just that, give you a heads up warning, not to be confused with those call the cops alarm systems, instead this should buy you precious minutes in case something is wrong.Great product, even useful if not for security purposes but to add to a window in case you have kids and want a warning they are opening a not so safe window or door.

Reviews.Title: DO THE JOB
Reviews.Author: Y. Figuereo
Reviews.Content: I put the alarm in the front door and in the windows.  This is an excellent and cheap choice to feel secure when you are alone at home.!

Reviews.Title: Low cost and Really works
Reviews.Author: Winston
Reviews.Content: This alarm system is a steal for 20 dollars. It works extremely well and is everything that I hoped it would be. It comes with one door alarm and 3 window alarms, but we used one of the window alarms on our sliding glass doors, which works too! I will say that the alarms are not linked (example: If the window alarm goes off, the door and other window alarms have no idea it is going off, and do not trigger. Thus, the system functions as 4 separate alarms). The set up is easy, with easy directions. If you don't want to pay high fees with alarm companies, this is the next best thing. A wonderful product on amazon! Oh and one last thing...the window alarms all come with batteries but the door alarm does not. The door alarm requires I believe 3 or 4 AAA batteries, so prepare for that.

Reviews.Title: Wireless alarm system kit
Reviews.Author: Keith Veldhuizen
Reviews.Content: Works exactly as advertised and we are very  happy with the products. Easy to install, easy to disable and set up alarm system.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough
Reviews.Author: jlynn810
Reviews.Content: I bought this alarm system until could afford to have a professional monitored alam put in. We protect our house with the second amendment so I wanted something that would be loud enough to wake me up so that I can get to what I need to get to if someone w to break in.The keypad alarm is very loud and would easily wake up and scare anyone that broke in or was sleeping. The smaller window alarms are not nearly as loud, would still wake you up but are not as ear hurting as the keypad alarm is. It's easy to install just some sticky tape on the back of them line up the magnets and you are set. The keypad alarm is the same and very easy to set your code as well. We set it mostly at night but the away function works great as well.

Reviews.Title: helpful
Reviews.Author: Mawil tejeda
Reviews.Content: very helpful, specially for apaments, keep away unautorzed visitants from your house or aparment, alarm its very loud and the window alarms too, great product and good price

Reviews.Title: Easy to set up
Reviews.Author: r warn
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up, very loud- definitely recommend. Just don't forget it shut the alarm off before you open the door in the morning- quite the surprise!

Reviews.Title: Now this is an alarm
Reviews.Author: JLSMom
Reviews.Content: This alarm definitely delivers. Extremely easy set up and extremely loud (which would be the point right?!!). I can hear is from the other side of my home, even with the door closed. I would definitely purchase more if needed.

Reviews.Title: Very loud
Reviews.Author: RV guy
Reviews.Content: Main unit is very loud, window units not as loud.  All seem to work well.  Chime mode on main unit would be good for business or child safety.  Keep in mind what they are made for.  Intruder alert when you're home, or noise maker when you're gone.  They work well for that.  Loud, piercing, and annoying, which is what I wanted.  Mounting is for the most part easy but you might have to be creative depending on what type of surface you have.  Double sided tape is good, but only on a flat smooth surface.  I had to use the screw holes.  So far very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Be Realistic
Reviews.Author: Black endorsement
Reviews.Content: Look, if someone really wants to break into your house, they will. Hell, even precious art gets stolen from museums and banks get robbed. But for the 25% of the population that doesn't overreact as though they have a drawer full of diamonds or jedi ninja assassins out to get them, these type of home security products are just fine. People usually get robbed because they were an easy target, like an open window or having an open mouth about what's in your house.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: I've been looking at options and for $20 this is a great product. I feel much safer and I like I can program in a code for when I am gone. I did receive the set and one of the units did not work- I contacted Amazon and they sent out a replacement right away. I decided I could use the extra units for other windows so they gave me a discount to keep the other set.  So far so good!! Great value!!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Dizzie Dee
Reviews.Content: The door chime feature is great and the alarm is very loud. Was really easy to set up and install.

Reviews.Title: Great, cheap home alarm.
Reviews.Author: hilary comstock
Reviews.Content: The product lives up to it's description. The alarm sounds loud on both the door and windows. Easy to set up, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Living alone
Reviews.Author: Amber Lankford
Reviews.Content: I am living alone as a girl for the first time in my life and it really makes me feel better knowing i have these to give me a heads up or alert the neighbors. They were very easy to install.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: kdogg
Reviews.Content: Decent product got for a good price. Would buy again because of the price and the purpose it serves for sense of security

Reviews.Title: nice Gift
Reviews.Author: Frank Slatinsky
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for my daughter, and she says the installation was a snap. She also said the alarm was enough to wake the dead , so it should scare away any unwanted guests in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: good for the price.
Reviews.Author: camela cornelius
Reviews.Content: I am very shocked how loud it is. However it is only loud in ur house. My neighbors can't hear it at when it goes off and they are right beside me. It probably would scare someone off but honestly they could just rip it off the wall and break it. But it is alright

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Irene Thiry
Reviews.Content: the work grate and it makes me fell safer when it just me and my kid home that i will know if some one is trying to get in

Reviews.Title: alarm!!!!! LOUD!!!!!
Reviews.Author: david (yo yo) "david hockemeier"
Reviews.Content: works great and now my home feels more secure and more peaceful then before. i have done other things for my daughter like cover up outlets and stove so im definitely heading in the right direction. and i must say 120 db is extremely loud!!!!! thanks

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Catherine Pagan
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this product from Home Depot to put a the home I was staying with a friend.  When I moved into my own place I purchased it for myself. The product works and the expensive monthly monitoring fee is not needed.  I know that having monitoring if there is a break in is good but the fees are so expensive and this product sounds very loud it would scare anyone away.

Reviews.Title: VERY LOUD
Reviews.Author: Cato
Reviews.Content: Be careful installing - cover it with something like a towel as is very loud and a high frequency - my ears are still numb a bit and not in a good way.  Have to return as will not work on my door jambs.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This is a good deal, everything works great so far.  Haven't had any issues with opening the door too fast and the alarm not triggering. It's simple to use and loud.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader
Reviews.Content: It is wireless insofar as there are no wires to connect the separate units. There is however no wireless connectivity or radio communication.The units do work and are pretty loud, but the use of wireless is a bit of a stretch.

Reviews.Title: Good and I feel safe
Reviews.Author: E. Nasser
Reviews.Content: This alarm system was everything I expected and I feel so much safer with it.  It was easy to install (just stick on - but carefully).I recommend it for apartments and homes.

Reviews.Title: Seems promising.
Reviews.Author: Lucky Lapic
Reviews.Content: VERY LOUD!Ear shattering in a small apartment unit. I had to cover the main door unit with some tape and cotton to absorb the sound a bit to protect my hearing.  My dogs hate it. Maybe charge a little more and offer the product with sound settings.I have no doubt that it will startle an intruder.  (It gives you 30-45 seconds to input the code before it goes off unless you put it in Home/Alarm mode).Very effective despite the loudness. When set on the "Home/Chime" mode, it sounds like a dressing room chime. "Bing-Bong"You will need 3 AAA batteries for the door unit but everything else is included. (choice of using screws and/or back-to-back tape)Overall, for less than $25, I think I would buy it again and highly recommend it to family and friends. Peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: Scott Cho "SwooP"
Reviews.Content: The main one for the door is highly effective with the passcode.  Took forever to get it to stop if you get the code incorrect.  Extremely loud and effective for door access protection.  Windows are not as effective but they work.  Window alarms are easily disabled if they know the switch location.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: SurfMonkey
Reviews.Content: I only used the smaller units and not the main unit. The smaller units work well on sliding doors and windows. They come with adhesive tape for both pieces and they offer about 1/2inch or 2cm play before the alarm will sound. This is good because your window and the frame around it may not be exactly even.They are fairly loud and will alert you if someone opens something and you are asleep somewhere else in the home.

Reviews.Title: Good alarm
Reviews.Author: Ricky "RR"
Reviews.Content: LOUD! Which it is exactly what I was looking for, an affordable alarm system that will help me a little bit since I don't have 1 grand to install a professional service; I recommend this product, the first time that I tried it while I was installing it, I entered the wrong code and it was so loud that my dog ran away from the balcony of my apartment. Cons: if molding of the door or window is not flat it will give you a little bit of work to mount.

Reviews.Title: Defected unit
Reviews.Author: Kyung-hae SEO
Reviews.Content: Door Alarm is defected, blinking red light all the time and alarm goes on any settings so have to remove batteries.One of window unit is not working. I tried to return it but 2 of window unit was already mounted on the window frameand it is very hard to  remove it . Is there any way I can return Door alarm and one of the window alarm and have replacement?Please let me know what to do. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Very Loud
Reviews.Author: Robert Gardner
Reviews.Content: Love it and it helps me to feel a little safer at nightIt is very loud, which is a plus! Might scare someone off trying to break in for sureI would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Nice for apartment
Reviews.Author: Anna M.
Reviews.Content: Got this as a house warming gift for a girlfriend moving into a ground floor apartment. She's very happy with the set. The window alarms were a smaller size than I expected which is a nice plus. My friend likes that they are wireless and a breeze to instal. She feels more secure knowing she has an alarm system in place.

Reviews.Title: Needs on/off light
Reviews.Author: Marc Laibson
Reviews.Content: Door alarm: There is no way to tell if the alarm is set or not. Everyone in the house needs to enter the passcode every time to see if its on or off by listening if it beeps once or twice. They need an led light to visually verify that its on. Its no fun when you open the door thinking its off and the alarm blares in your ear. Its also not good thinking its on and protecting you when in fact its actually not. The only way to tell is by entering your passcode and listening if it beeps once or twice.Window alarm: they work well but only alarm when the window is opened, meaning they turn off the moment you shut the window again or move the switch to off, unlike the door alarm which requires you to enter the code. They are also not as loud as the door alarm.

Reviews.Title: For the price, you just can't beat this system for places where no outside monitoring is possible.
Reviews.Author: Captain Billy "Captain Billy"
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these for an empty condo with no phone service.  Was so impressed that I got more sets for the boat and the shed.  The chime feature is also useful for use on screen doors.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: vonniezee
Reviews.Content: gives me a piece of mind ... alarm and door chime is LOOOOOOOUD! definitely a ear piercer! looks nice, stays on nice, good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Baizelovers
Reviews.Content: This product was purchased with intent to make sure my 2 year old does not get out of house unnoticed. This product was packaged appropriately and works the way it is suppose to. I give 100% satisfaction

Reviews.Title: Great Feel Good Product
Reviews.Author: Yes Me
Reviews.Content: I got this item for my in-laws after they had someone try to get into their back yard, and another person hide in their garage when the cops were after them. The product is very easy to use and the install is very quick. Just clean the surface with rubbing alcohol, allow it to dry, apply double sided tape to product, double check alignment, and peel & stick each piece. The item is very loud and can easily be heard by the neighbors if you live in a subdivision. While installing the window sensors I tested the alignment a few times and the neighbor kept looking outside. This item is not a real alarm system but is perfect for making you feel better. As long as the alarm is set, they will go off whenever a window or door is open. This gives you a warning and a few extra seconds to call 911, get your gun, bat, knife, or pepper spray. For anyone other than a career criminal the item is loud enough to scare them off.As for the reviewers saying that the alarm doesn't go off for 30-45sec when the door is open needs to adjust the setting to HOME. When its set to home the alarm goes off the second the 1/2" gap is made. The AWAY mode is when you have 45 seconds to leave and 30 seconds to turn off the alarm when entering the house.I also ordered the door stop alarmsGE 50246 Smart Home Door Stop Alarm for them and those are extremely loud. With these 2 item and making sure they keep all doors, gates and windows locked they feel a lot safer. My in-laws are in their late 60's and still think that people are nice and honest like they used to be. They went from never locking anything and leaving doors and windows open all the time to locking everything. Most crimes are opportunity crimes, keep your doors, windows and gates locked. Don't leave your blinds open showing off your big screen tv, surround sound, gaming systems, computers, cameras, etc......Also do not allow door to door sales people in your home, many are felons and are scoping your place out. My in laws experienced this the day before someone tried to get into their back yard. A guy came by trying to sell a cleaning product and a little while later a lady came by trying to sell the same product. It was after my father in law left (no cars in driveway) and the lady pushed on the door when my mother in law said no and tried to shut the door. When I brought up the door to door sales people she mentioned this to me. She said the lady wanted to see what products my mother in law could use in her home. BS she was looking at what they could steal.Be Safe!!

Reviews.Title: louder than I would have thought
Reviews.Author: Nancy J. Gray
Reviews.Content: such a small unit for such a loud voice...easy to set to shut off when we enter...we live rurally and the neighbors have had small break ins. This is just enough to scare 'em off

Reviews.Title: It'll do for now
Reviews.Author: Spring Wilde
Reviews.Content: Can't expect a heck of lot from a $35.00 alarm system. Reviews.Title: good value

Reviews.Title: Really good product for the money!

Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our home because there have been a rash of burgleries in our town. We were not interested in setting up a huge wireless system, but more in alarming some doors and windows that are not used frequently.The package arrived quickly, have to love Amazon Prime, and the instructions (looks long at first, the book is fairly thick) are step by step and easy to follow. The main alarm is quite loud, defeaning almost, as when we tested it (we placed in on an unused side door) we had to place a sweatshirt over it so as to not wake everyone in the neighborhood. The smaller (window) alarms are not as loud, but will get the job done just fine.Simple, yet effective, I would recommend this system to anyone who has only 10 minutes, a screwdriver and a need to alarm their windows/doors.

Reviews.Title: Holy cow, it's LOUD & great!

The chime lets me know when guest have entered during a party and at night I know that I will hear the alarm should a door or window be opened. It is pretty inexpensive as well.

Reviews.Title: Very scary and loud sound for burglar
Reviews.Author: Quebechunt
Reviews.Content: I've just received my new GE Wireless alarm system and tried it immediately, the instructions are clear and very easy to set up. I've opened the back lid of the main control and placed 3 fresh AAA battery inside, then press the "learn" button right next to the battery compartment and then enter my 4 digit PIN number. Closed everything back and tried it by entering again my PIN number and placing the side button to "alarm". Place the little door side part aligned with the main control panel and separated it from it after...WOWWWWW!!!! What a blast!!!! The siren went on and almost pierce my ears. If ever a burglar try to get in my hunting cabin while I'm away, my neighbours will know it right away and they will call the authorities, but meanwhile the burglar won't stay in and will get away because the sound is very loud. Hihihihihi, I think that I will also place my trail camera right next to my GE wireless alarm system just to capture their face expression, that will be funny:) The other independent windows and doors systems are not as loud as the main one but still shout enough to scare the burglar and maybe alert my close ones. Buy this product with confidence it works well and is worth the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Effective and a Great Value for the Price
Reviews.Author: Laura Temple
Reviews.Content: I bought this pack of alarms a couple months ago when I moved to a new apartment.  It was robbed 2 weeks after I moved (through the fire escape window). The crooks stole thousands of dollars worth of things, but most of all, I felt so violated. I live in an older pre-war building in Queens NY, so I wasn't sure if a real alarm system would be cost-effective, plus I not even sure how long I'll be living there (and you need a landline, which I gave up years ago). With that said I purchased this package because I had the freedom to set my own 4 digit code for the door alarm. I thought this would be a good way to scare off any potential intruders if they broke in through the door or fire escape windows.They were easy to set up, the door alarm was easy to set as well. I originally had it set to the "chime" feature, but it was so obnoxiously loud. I knew my neighbors would not be happy with me if they had to hear it every time I came in and out of my apartment. The alarms are very loud as well. My boyfriend "accidentally" tested one of the window alarms one afternoon and it was loud enough for people on many floors to hear. I also like the option to set them on/off/chime so I have the freedom to open an alarmed window while I'm home. I feel a lot more comfortable leaving the apartment for long periods of time now that I have these.Learn from my misfortune! If you live in a city put these on windows that someone may have easy access to. Don't wait until something happens to buy them!

These thing are made to work on doors no with casing around them, limiting them to almost no application what so ever. As far as the window sensors same thing, these are made for a new window application, even on my sliding glass doors there is to much of a gap between the door and the jam. unless you make a bunch of shims to fur the sensors out to line up they wont work. They are made for brand new windows and if you live in a place with brand new windows you are probably set up with an alarm system. They are made to work with two perfectly flat surfaces ! I should have know better, I know they were 20 bucks but still come on, when have you seen a front or back door with no casing around it! These things are useless, I cant find a single door or window in my apartment that I can find a surface to make the sensors line up. You will have to go to the hardware store and buy a bunch of double sided tape and other material to possibly make these line up! WASTE OF MONEY! DONT BUY! WILL BE RETURNING THE TRASH!

Reviews.Content: Better than paying for a monthly security system but of course won't actually protect your house from break-ins.  Most home systems don't protect your house either but an alarm will often DETER a burglar once the sounds goes off.  They either take off immediately or only grab things within arms length (unless they are professionals).  So this definitely gives me peace of mind without having to pay a monthly fee.  It's also a great security warning if an intruder breaks in while you are home.  Last year we had a home invasion when my husband had just turned in for the night upstairs.  He heard some rustling around and thought I had come home early, then after calling out to me, he heard the sound of several people whispering and scrambling around downstairs. Reviews.Title: Great When Travelling
Reviews.Author: Avery Alavi
Reviews.Content: I agree with many reviewers that the window alarms are not as loud as the main door alarm (but still extremely piercing to the ears). However, when I bought a separate package of window GE window alarms (Comes in a package of 4), they were much louder. Maybe because they had a thin film of plastic under the batteries that you have to pull out before using. The 3 window alarms that came in this Kit did not have a plastic under the batteries. Maybe this is why the sound is a little less piercing, because the batteries are a little older. But don't be mistaken, they still hurt your ears! The main reason I bought this was because I'm going to stay in a one story vacation home in Utah, which is a little ways from the main town, and the pictures of the home showed that there is a glass door opening to the yard for each bedroom. I am planning to take these little door and window alarms with me and mount them to every one of these glass doors and windows in the house. Best advise I can give is to buy clear mounting tape (The kind that you can peel off after which doesn't cause any paint damage). Then you can pretty much adjust these guys to any window sill (new or old, molding or no molding).  I also would NOT recommend using the "Away" feature of the bigger alarm when you are at home, because it takes too long to go off when tripped.  A burglar could easily come in the house, take what he needs in 30 seconds, and leave before the alarm goes off. So keep it on "Home" when you are home. When I am out of the house, i'll probably put it on "Away", so that I can exit the house and still have an alarm activated. Just remember when you have it activated because there is no light that tells you when it is on. And you don't want to make the mistake of going deaf to these very loud alarms. Overall, I am very happy with this system and with the smaller window alarms. I like the fact that you need a screw driver to open the back of the main box in order to program your code. Otherwise, anyone can get there hands on it and reprogram it. I feel much more comfortable heading to this Utah vacation condo. I'm sure many people have copies of keys to this condo, and this will keep the cleaning crew and maintenance people out when I am in the house. Another thing I will do is put a sign "Beware of Dog" and "alarm signs" on the windows of the house.I'm not sure how long this system will last, but we'll see. It's nice that it only requires 3 AAA batteries (not included) for the main alarm, and 4 small round batteries (included) for the window alarms.

Reviews.Title: The window monitors make for a great doorbell!
Reviews.Author: Duane A. Priest
Reviews.Content: I bought these primarily to use on the windows and doors in my basement.  Crime is very low in our area, and I didn't feel the need to buy an expensive alarm system or to add a service.  These sounded like they would fit my needs well.  I will say that in alarm mode, these little units put out more sound than I thought possible... they do work!  The small units are designed for use with windows, and they're ideal.  They simply stick on with double-sided tape and they're small enough to place out of sight.  A switch allows you to turn them off as necessary, too.The unit with the keypad for use with a door is a bit different.  It's substantially larger and the siren in it is indeed louder, but the keypad function just doesn't cut it for me.  Too often I've turned the unit on instead of off, or the buttons failed to work when I entered the code, and the alarm goes off and is difficult to turn off.  I ended up tearing the unit off the door (which is easy because of the double-stick tape) and smashed it on the floor to shut it up when I couldn't turn it off.  It went into the trash.I did have an extra window monitor, so I placed that on the door.  With the switch, I can set it to act as a doorbell of sorts, chiming when the door is opened.  That's perfect for my needs; more useful to me than the alarm. For that reason, I'm giving the system 2 stars... there is value to the system for this use, and considering the low price of the system, I feel like I got some value from the purchase.  Other than for a use like this, I would NOT recommend this product to anyone.
